abstract: Food and Drug Administration proposes ban on powdered medical gloves, citing health risks of powder used; agency first warned of threat in late 1990s, but feared ban would cause disruptive shortage of essential medical gear.
lead_paragraph: The agency, which started to warn about the gloves in 1997, said the lubricating powder could inflame wounds and cause scars between organs and tissue.

headline.main: F.D.A. Proposes a Ban on Powdered Medical Gloves
headline.print_headline: F.D.A. Proposes Banning Powdered Medical Gloves

snippet: The agency, which started to warn about the gloves in 1997, said the lubricating powder could inflame wounds and cause scars between organs and tissue.
